qas.question: What disaster destroyed many of the early buildings in Richmond?
What percentage of Richmond's buildings were burned in a single fire in 1865?
Prior to what year was the Patterson-Schutte House built?
What is the name of the era from which the building housing the Edgar Allan Poe Museum dates?

context: Much of Richmond's early architecture was destroyed by the <a0_0>Evacuation Fire<a0_0/> in 1865. It is estimated that <a1_0>25<a1_0/>% of all buildings in Richmond were destroyed during this fire. Even fewer now remain due to construction and demolition that has taken place since Reconstruction. In spite of this, Richmond contains many historically significant buildings and districts. Buildings remain from Richmond's <a3_0>colonial<a3_0/> period, such as the Patteson-Schutte House and the Edgar Allan Poe Museum (Richmond, Virginia), both built before <a2_0>1750<a2_0/>.
